resources.string: Cognitive Measures

The following are a series of cognitive tasks, several of which are the versions of the tasks you completed in the original Project Talent study.

 	• Read the instructions for each task carefully.
 	• Do the best you can. If you are unsure of the right answer, pick the one you think is the best.
 	• If a task includes multiple-choice questions, select only one answer.
 	• There is only one right answer for each question.

 Press the NEXT button to begin the first task.

You have completed the puzzles.

 IMPORTANT! Please press "Finish" to be sure all of your answers are saved.

 Once you press "Finish" the program will close. Press the droidSURVEY button to complete the survey questions.
Begin
Back
Finish
INSTRUCTIONS\n\n This task contains words for you to define. The items are multiple choice - select the best response for each word.
Vocabulary
Number Series

plurals.item: Please enter the number that belongs in the empty box. Then press \'Next\' to continue.
Please enter the number that belongs in the empty boxes. Then press \'Next\' to continue.

resources.string: Example 2 Answer

INSTRUCTIONS

 • You will now see six more questions like the ones you just did.
 • Please enter the number that belongs in each empty box.
 • The numbers might increase, like 2, 4, 6, or decrease, like 6, 4, 2.
 • You may be asked a question with more than one empty box in the sequence.
 • Some of the questions may be easy but others may be hard. Just do the best you can.

 If you are ready to begin, please press 'Next' to continue.
Undo
Please press \"Next\" to continue.

{ "id": 1, "question": "INSTRUCTIONS

 In this task, on each screen you will see several numbers that make up a series. There will be one or more empty boxes somewhere in the series. Sometimes an empty box will be at the end of the series, sometimes in the middle, and sometimes at the beginning. Please tap the number buttons to enter the number that goes into each empty box. The answer will be a number between 0 and 99.

 Here is an example. Enter the number that goes in the empty box. Then press 'Next' to continue.", "options": [1, 2, 3, 4], "ansPosition": 2, "answerText": "INSTRUCTIONS

The answer we were looking for is 3, so the completed sequence is:" }

{ "id": 2, "question": "INSTRUCTIONS

Below is another example.
Please enter the number that belongs in the empty box. Then press 'Next' to continue.", "options": [2, 4, 6, 8], "ansPosition": 3, "answerText": "INSTRUCTIONS

The answer we were looking for is 8 because the numbers (2, 4, 6, 8) increase by 2. The completed sequence is:" }
Abstract Reasoning
INSTRUCTIONS\n\n Each item in this task consists of a set of figures arranged in a pattern formed according to certain rules. Look at the following patterns in the example.

The question mark (?) in the lower right corner of the box shows where a figure is missing in the pattern. Choose which of the five figures (A, B, C, D or E) under the pattern belongs where the \"?\" is.\n\n Then press \"Next\" to continue.

In the case of the example, the correct answer is E. In the top row, the figure at the right is the same as the one to the left of it except that it has been turned upside down. Following these rules, the figure that goes at the \"?\" should be larger than the one above it, and exactly the same size as the one to the left of it, but upside down. Therefore, E is the correct answer.\n\n Please press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS

In each question, you are to decide what figure belongs where the "?" is in the pattern. To do this you have to figure out what the rule is according to which the drawings change, going from row to row, and what the rule is for the changes going from column to column. The items have different kinds of patterns and different rules by which the drawings change.

Please press "Next" to continue.
Would you like to see another example, or are you ready to start this task?
Another example
Start task

Here is another example. Going from left to right, the circles get larger, and going from top to bottom they get darker. Therefore the answer has to be a circle which is the largest of the three sizes, and the darkest. Choices C and E are both the right size, but E is the only large circle with the correct shading. Thus E is the only drawing that fits in the pattern formed by the other circles. E is the answer that should be chosen.\n\n Please press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS

Now look at another example, which is quite different from either of the previous ones.

 Choose the figure that belongs at the "?" below, then press "Next" to continue.

If you study the pattern you will see that going from left to right there is one more line in each figure than in the one to the left of it. Going from top to bottom, the number of lines in any figure is one less than in the figure just above it. Therefore, the missing figure should have three lines. The correct answer is choice C (the three lines, slanting in the proper direction).\n\n Please press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS

 • You will now be asked six more questions like the ones you just did. 
 • For each question, decide what rules the pattern follows. Choose the answer that belongs in "?" by pressing the answer.
 • Many of the patterns are based on rules that are different from the ones in the sample items.
 If you are ready to begin, please press "Next".
Start Now
INSTRUCTIONS
Choose which figure belongs at the \"?\" by pressing the correct figure. Then press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS\n\nLook at the figures below. The first figure is shaped like the letter L. The rest of the figures are like the first, except that they have been turned (rotated) in different directions.
Please press \"Next\" to continue.

If you think of the figure at the left below as being made out of wire and lying on a table, the positions shown in each of the other four figures could be made simply by turning (rotating) the wire figure at the left around, without lifting it off the table. \n\n Please press \"Next\" to continue.

INSTRUCTIONS\n\nNow look at the next row of figures. The first figure is shaped like the letter P. But for the rest of the drawings, even if they were turned (rotated), they would still be backwards; you would have to lift the figure at the left off the table and flip it over to make any of the other figures.

INSTRUCTIONS\n\nIn this task each question has one figure at the left and five similar figures to the right of it. Only one of the five figures on the right exactly matches the figure at the left if you turn (rotate) it. The rest of the figures are backwards even when they are turned (rotated).
Now look at the sample question below.\nChoose the one figure which, when turned (rotated), exactly matches the figure at the left?
INSTRUCTIONS\n\nYou should have picked the fourth answer choice. All of the other choices have been \"lifted off the table and flipped over\" as well as turned (rotated), and thus are backwards.
For each question in this task, choose the one figure which, when turned (rotated), exactly matches the figure at the left.\n\n If you are ready to begin, please press \"Next\".
Choose the one figure which, when turned (rotated), exactly matches the figure at the left.

Reaction Time
Please enter your user ID.\n\nThis is the same number you entered for the first part of the survey.
Thank you for completing the Reaction Time Test
You may now exit by tapping on the SPACEBAR
SPACEBAR
Thank you for completing the test.
You can now exit by tapping on the exit button below.
Exit
You may now exit by tapping on the exit button below.

This task measures your speed. You will be shown a black cross for a few seconds, followed by a red circle. Then the cross will appear again, followed by the circle, and so on.

 Your task is to:
 (1) hold your finger over the SPACEBAR button.
 (2) focus on the cross
 (3) each time you see the red circle press the SPACEBAR as quickly as you can

 When you are ready to begin, press the SPACEBAR button.
That is correct.
Now you will practice.
You will see each picture for 5 seconds. Make use of the time and study each picture carefully, for the full 5 seconds.
Press \'Next\' when you are ready to begin.
Incorrect, the picture you actually saw was this …
Now click on the picture you have seen.
Please press \'Next\' to go to the next task.

The next task measures your memory. You will see a series of pictures for 5 seconds each. You will then see the original picture along with several similar pictures. Your task is to pick which of the pictures is the one you saw previously.\n\n For example, you will see a picture like this …
Tap the picture you studied, then press \'Next\'.
Now click on the picture you have seen.
Then later you will see the first picture along with several similar pictures, like these. Please tap the picture which is the same as the one you saw previously.
Now, click on the picture you have studied.
Thurstone Example
Thank you for completing the test.
Thurstone

Now that you have practiced, it is time to begin the task.
 The procedure is the same as before. You will see each picture for 5 seconds.
 Use the time to study each picture carefully.

 When you are ready, press 'Begin'.
